Basil.name: Basil
Basil.blurb: Adds a sweet, herbal aroma that pairs well with gin and citrus.

Blackberry.name: Blackberry
Blackberry.blurb: A sweet, slightly tart berry that adds color and flavor to cocktails.

Cherry.name: Cherry
Cherry.blurb: Classic cocktail garnish for spirit-forward drinks and flaming presentations.

Cinnamon.name: Cinnamon
Cinnamon.blurb: Warm spice that complements whiskey, rum, and autumnal flavors.

CucumberSlice.name: CucumberSlice
CucumberSlice.blurb: Cool, clean flavor ideal for light, refreshing cocktails like gimlets.

EdibleFlower.name: EdibleFlower
EdibleFlower.blurb: Delicate floral note and visual flair for fragrant, botanical drinks.

LemonSlice.name: LemonSlice
LemonSlice.blurb: Bright citrus that balances sweetness and enhances aroma.

LemonTwist.name: LemonTwist
LemonTwist.blurb: Citrus oils from the twist add aromatic complexity to cocktails.

LimeSlice.name: LimeSlice
LimeSlice.blurb: Adds acidity and freshness; common with tequila and rum drinks.

LimeWedge.name: LimeWedge
LimeWedge.blurb: A lime wedge adds brightness and acidity that balances sweet and spirit-forward cocktails.

MintSprig.name: MintSprig
MintSprig.blurb: Fresh mint lends aromatic, cooling notes that pair well with rum and citrus.

Olive.name: Olive
Olive.blurb: Briny, savory garnish commonly used in martinis and savory cocktails.

OrangeSlice.name: OrangeSlice
OrangeSlice.blurb: Sweet citrus that complements dark spirits and riffs on classic cocktails.

OrangeTwist.name: OrangeTwist
OrangeTwist.blurb: Expressed orange oils add aroma and brighten spirit-forward drinks.

Peppercorn.name: Peppercorn
Peppercorn.blurb: Adds a spicy, aromatic pop that pairs well with savory cocktails.

PineappleSlice.name: PineappleSlice
PineappleSlice.blurb: Tropical sweetness and acidity for tiki and rum-forward drinks.

PineappleWedge.name: PineappleWedge
PineappleWedge.blurb: Larger tropical garnish for visually bold presentations.

Raspberry.name: Raspberry
Raspberry.blurb: Bright, tart berry that adds color and a delicate flavor.

Rosemary.name: Rosemary
Rosemary.blurb: Piney, herbal sprig that adds aroma and pairs with gin and whiskey.

Strawberry.name: Strawberry
Strawberry.blurb: Sweet berry garnish often used in fruity cocktails and seasonal drinks.

Umbrella.name: Umbrella
Umbrella.blurb: Tropical, playful garnish commonly used in tiki-style cocktails.

AbsintheGlass.name: AbsintheGlass
AbsintheGlass.blurb: Specialized glass for absinthe rituals and measured pours.

BrandySnifterGlass.name: BrandySnifterGlass
BrandySnifterGlass.blurb: A rounded bowl concentrates aromas for brandy and cognac.

CollinsGlass.name: CollinsGlass
CollinsGlass.blurb: Tall, narrow glass for long drinks served with ice and mixers.

CopperMug.name: CopperMug
CopperMug.blurb: Traditional vessel for Moscow Mule-style cocktails that stays cold.

CordialGlass.name: CordialGlass
CordialGlass.blurb: Small stemmed glass for liqueurs and after-dinner drinks.

CoupeGlass.name: CoupeGlass
CoupeGlass.blurb: Wide, shallow glass for up cocktails and sparkling serves.

DemitasseGlass.name: DemitasseGlass
DemitasseGlass.blurb: Very small cup used for strong, espresso-based drinks and liqueurs.

FizzGlass.name: FizzGlass
FizzGlass.blurb: A straight-sided glass ideal for shaken, fizzy cocktails.

FluteGlass.name: FluteGlass
FluteGlass.blurb: Tall, narrow glass for sparkling wines and Champagne cocktails.

GobletGlass.name: GobletGlass
GobletGlass.blurb: Large-bowled glass for aromatic cocktails and sippers.

HighballGlass.name: HighballGlass
HighballGlass.blurb: Tall glass for long drinks served over ice with a mixer.

HurricaneGlass.name: HurricaneGlass
HurricaneGlass.blurb: Curvy glass for tropical and blended cocktails.

IrishCoffeeGlass.name: IrishCoffeeGlass
IrishCoffeeGlass.blurb: Heatproof glass with handle for hot cocktails like Irish coffee.

JulepCup.name: JulepCup
JulepCup.blurb: Metal cup for mint juleps that keeps the drink icy cold.

MargaritaGlass.name: MargaritaGlass
MargaritaGlass.blurb: Shallow, wide-rimmed glass ideal for salt or sugar rims.

MartiniGlass.name: MartiniGlass
MartiniGlass.blurb: Classic conical glass for up cocktails and martinis.

NickAndNoraGlass.name: NickAndNoraGlass
NickAndNoraGlass.blurb: Small, elegant stemmed glass for spirit-forward cocktails.

ParfaitGlass.name: ParfaitGlass
ParfaitGlass.blurb: Tall, narrow glass often used for layered or dessert cocktails.

PilsnerGlass.name: PilsnerGlass
PilsnerGlass.blurb: Tall tapered glass typically used for beer and long beers-based cocktails.

PousseCafeGlass.name: PousseCafeGlass
PousseCafeGlass.blurb: Narrow, layered glass used for colorful pousse-cafe drinks.

PunchGlass.name: PunchGlass
PunchGlass.blurb: Large bowl-style glass for punches and shared cocktails.

RocksGlass.name: RocksGlass
RocksGlass.blurb: Short, wide glass for spirits served neat or on the rocks.

ShotGlass.name: ShotGlass
ShotGlass.blurb: Small glass for straight shots and layered shooters.

SlingGlass.name: SlingGlass
SlingGlass.blurb: Classic straight-sided glass for early mixed drinks like the sling.

SnifterGlass.name: SnifterGlass
SnifterGlass.blurb: Rounded bowl that concentrates aromas for brandy and spirits.

SourGlass.name: SourGlass
SourGlass.blurb: Stemmed glass well-suited to sours and shaken cocktails.

TankardGlass.name: TankardGlass
TankardGlass.blurb: Sturdy handled mug for warm or hearty drinks.

TikiGlass.name: TikiGlass
TikiGlass.blurb: Decorative, themed glass typical for tropical tiki cocktails.

ToddyGlass.name: ToddyGlass
ToddyGlass.blurb: Heatproof glass for hot toddies and warm cocktails.

WineGlass.name: WineGlass
WineGlass.blurb: Stemmed glass for wine-based cocktails and spritzes.

PintGlass.name: PintGlass
PintGlass.blurb: Tall, cylindrical glass for serving beer and mixed drinks.
